item.title: A Summary of the Rust Book
item.description: Learning Rust with Excerpts and Examples from the Rust Book The GitHub repository for this is here: Learning Rust Please click on the star button on the repo on GitHub to support this effort. Here is a sentence from the book: “Nothing in Rust prevents a trait from having a method with the same name as another traitâ€™s method, nor does Rust prevent you from implementing both traits on one type.

item.title: Ayu Theme for Vscode
item.description: Ayu Theme Color Pop Vscode Here is my new code editor look: Installing the plain old Ayu Theme was pretty bland by default, and I wasn’t able to see some of the text and sidebar icons after enabling the theme. I tinkered around a bit and found that I could change these colors by going under Settings -> Workspace -> Appearance and editing the settings.json file directly. Don’t be scared of messing around with this file, yes it screws up your editor but keep a backup and just hack away.

item.title: Travels: India
item.description: Life in India Lots of struggle initially, unemployed for a year! Too many people! Bad infrastructure, overall I had horrible experience getting used to the place ngl However, right now, I’m okay cool

item.title: Travels: Canada
item.description: Life in Canada Some doctor just idk he certified me not fit for work and they just kept me in a hospital for a while, and wouldn’t let me go. The worst part was I was forced to take meds that I didn’t want/need, but they just didn’t listen to me I knew it was just a temp thing till I get my citizenship and then I would be back in the US.

item.title: Travels: USA
item.description: Life in the US Most importantly, I learned how to support myself, and everything I needed to know to hone my craft and make a living. Literally nowhere else in the world would I have been able to learn this so well ( to the extent/degree/quality ) of I was taught both in university and during my employment there. The only issue is the immigration system, I didn’t really like it.

item.title: Travels: Hong Kong
item.description: Raised in Hong Kong The reason I say that I’m not actually completely from anywhere in the world, is because I was raised in Hong Kong from a very young age and I spent my entire teenage there. It was really amazing, wouldn’t have it any other way, the lights, the city nights, the food. Everything was spectacular and I had the most wonderful time there. It was really heartbreaking to leave all my friends and people I had gotten close to over the years and head back to India for grade 11, utter disdain.
